text: I know this is probably a complicated question, but is there any way in local dev tools to compile a static html version of the code you're looking at based off of the pages that are in your portal? I'm basically trying to set up a local dev environment that will allow me to build sites locally with browser watching and then push code when I'm done.

I've got it set up right now where I'm using the watch function to push new files to the server automatically, but I have to refresh the page after the changes are made and that's a little annoying. I'd just prefer to have the files served locally during dev instead of with a staging site set up.
what are you using to refresh the browser?
i ask because i think the CLI could help with this. See <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/2|https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/2>
I know I could load browsersync on the live page itself, but I'd really like to do development locally.
ahh, i'm in the wrong channel i think
Thanks, I've looked into this, but if I remember correctly,  I think this tool is kind of outdated.
you are gonna have to setup an entire build system to grab different files locally to your machine and have it fill in some of the blanks

yeah, i understand. thanks for sharing the feedback. one workflow that might be worth giving a spin is using a free dev sandox like you would a web server running locally. the benefit being that you can then use and explore all the other parts of the system while developing like the editors.
